clinical_study.brief_title: Low Dose Effects of X-rays in Pediatric Patients Undergoing a CT Examination.
clinical_study.official_title: National Study of Low Dose Effects of X-rays in Pediatric Patients Undergoing a CT Examination.

collaborator.agency: Federal Agency for Nuclear Control, Belgium

brief_summary.textblock: Patients undergoing a computed tomography are exposed to a relatively high dose of X-rays. Pediatric patients are known to be very radiosensitive with respect to radiation induced cancer. Using the technique of scoring γ-H2AX foci in peripheral blood lymphocytes the most important lesions to the genetic material DNA, double strand breaks induced by CT X-rays can be detected. The technique will be applied in a multicenter setting for evaluation of X-effects induced by a computed tomography examination in a population of pediatric patients. To this end a blood sample will be taken from the patients before and after the examination.

primary_outcome.measure: X-ray induced genetic effects in pediatric patients directly after a computed tomography scan.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30 min after the computed tomography examination.
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of γ -H2AX foci in peripheral blood lymphocytes.

clinical_study.condition: Pediatric Patients Undergoing a Computed Tomography Examination

intervention.description: Analysing X-ray induced genetic effects in pediatric patients directly after a computer tomography scan.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients undergoing computed tomography are exposed to a relatively high dose of X-rays.
